Authors: Sheng-Hua WU, Dongmei Wang, Yu-Ping CHEN
Title:
Purpureocorticium microsporum (Basidiomycota) gen. et sp.
nov. from East Asia
Keywords: China, new genus, new species, Taiwan, taxonomy
Abstract:
A corticioid fungal species found in mountainous Taiwan,
and Yunnan Province of China, is described as a new genus and new
species: Purpureocorticium microsporum (Agaricomycetes, Basidiomycota).
Morphological study and phylogenetic analyses based on sequence data
respectively derived from the large subunit nuclear ribosomal RNA gene
(LSU nrDNA) and the LSU nrDNA+translation elongation factor 1-Î± gene
(tef1), showed that Purpureocorticium is separated from other known
genera of corticioid fungi. Purpureocorticium and P. microsporum are
characterized by having a resupinate basidiocarp with smooth hymenial
surface which turns purple in KOH, and becomes purplish after storage;
microscopically having compact texture of subiculum, nodose-septate
thin-walled generative hyphae, absence of cystidia, basidia subclavate
with a medium constriction, or utriform, bearing ovate-ellipsoid
small-sized basidiospores, which are smooth and thin-walled, inamyloid
and indextrinoid. Two sets of phylogenetic analyses indicated that
Purpureocorticium does not belong to all known clades of
Agaricomycetes.
